title: My Teacher: complete a 30 page essay in size 11.5 font and 1.15 spacing
body:
Me: Here is a 14 page paper, missing some (completed 15 out of 20) sections from your template, in the format requested

My Teacher: Seems legit, have a C+

If I do a shitty job at something, I need to get reprimanded. I felt my paper was appalling and half-assed by my standards...  

I feel like the carebear nature of schooling is making us as a society soft, because we don't want feelings to be hurt. 

I feel like as a whole, we are being a bunch of pansies and need to be held accountable from an external force to help push us to be our best selves, lest we spiral down into a pit of laziness and neglect. 

I never thought I'd be salty about passing something, but I  mean come on. i realistically put about 20 hours of work through the whole semester, procrastinated and turned in a half assed, half finished paper when other students probably put in at least 80 hours. It was my term paper. as in, for the class I need to complete as a "capstone" to graduate. I passed with complete bullshit.


Why are we like this?

/rant
